title: dc?
body: for the previous days ive been having connection issues, when i load up a game it says i have crashed when i reconnect it says my net is having issues, so i restarted my internet but it is still saying it, i uninstalled league then redownload it still says the same anybody help me plz?

replies.body: yey dont worry i found out that u have to uninstall lol replay
basically after champ select i disconnect and says i crash, when i spam reconnect says try to fix my internet but my internet is fine, i also saw another thread about this happening to him to

Hey there,

Sorry i didn't reply to you sooner, in the future could you please reply to me by clicking the reply button at the bottom of my post so I receive a notification, thanks :).

Anyway, do you run lolreplay or any third party tools relating to league? If so, try disabling these and let me know if this helps.

Could you also [download WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/download-winmtr/) and run a traceroute to the following IP's (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes) and post the results here for me.

>103.240.227.5
103.240.227.25

Hey KaSings,

I suggest you repair the client and switch to a public DNS server. If this dosn't work, 
Take a log of your client (this can be done in the same screen that you go into to repair the client) and attach it to a support ticket to Riot. 

This will let riot know what's going on and how to fix it.
Riot are the best equipped and can help you with your issue if you attach client logs. :)

Hope I helped

Hey there,

Could you provide more info, does this occur every game (Even in custom games)?

Could you try [switching to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5) and letting me know if that resolves the issue, if not we can work on possible other causes.
